page.title: 14Breakfast Survey
page.content: Breakfast Survey at Ladysmith First School. On 11th June, 1985, 432 children, aged between 5 and 8 years, were asked what they had to eat and drink before coming to school. Very few children had anything cooked(bacon, egg or sausage.). A similar percentage (7.8%) had porridge. One child had soup. Cereal was very popular. Often two or more varieties were mixed. Weetabix was the most popular. Many children also had more than one drink;often a hot and cold drink. The most popular drink was tea, drunk by 127 children (29%). 125 children had cold milk, often with cereal. Excluding cold milk, hot and cold drinks were equally popular. The favorite cold drink after milk was orange juice(55 children). With the children white bread was more popular for toast than brown.
